The demand for new skincare ingredients, especially based on natural products, strongly increased during the last few decades

2 . Plant bioactive metabolites are most of the time free from harmful side effects, hence, great importance is given to the research of naturally occurring anti-ageing agents. Several plants proved to be effective to slow down skin ageing
3 , acting as antioxidants, protecting skin against solar radiations
4 , and/or modulating the activity of enzymes involved in the ageing processes
5 , among which elastase (Ela) and tyrosinase (Tyr) are of remarkable importance.
